bug.author: sayakpaul
bug.summary: [comp:data] link invalid in the "Analyze tf.data performance with the TF Profiler" guide
bug.description:
Thank you for submitting a TensorFlow documentation issue. Per our GitHub policy, we only address code/doc bugs, performance issues, feature requests, and build/installation issues on GitHub. The TensorFlow docs are open source! To get involved, read the documentation contributor guide: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/community/contribute/docs>https://www.tensorflow.org/community/contribute/docs</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>URL(s) with the issue: https://www.tensorflow.org/guide/data_performance_analysis</denchmark-h>
Please provide a link to the documentation entry, for example: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/guide/data_performance_analysis#3_are_you_reaching_high_cpu_utilization>https://www.tensorflow.org/guide/data_performance_analysis#3_are_you_reaching_high_cpu_utilization</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Description of issue (what needs changing):</denchmark-h>
Referring to the following line:
tf.data achieves high throughput by trying to make the best possible use of available resources. In general, even when running your model on an accelerator like a GPU or TPU, the tf.data pipelines are run on the CPU. You can check your utilization with tools like sar and htop, or in the cloud monitoring console if youâ€™re running on GCP.
The link attached to "cloud monitoring console" is invalid.

comments.comment: I'dl like to take this up.

I am closing this issue as it is resolved in through the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/docs/pull/1648>tensorflow/docs#1648</denchmark-link> that was merged already. New change will be reflected soon. <denchmark-link:https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/docs/monitoring_in_console>here</denchmark-link> is the correct link. Thanks!
